    • Constructor Detail

      • ChatFrame

        public ChatFrame(java.lang.String botName,
                 java.lang.Boolean traceMode,
                 java.lang.String action,
                 javax.swing.JDesktopPane desktop,
                 org.slf4j.Logger log)
        Creates a new Chat Frame within the Desktop to allow the user to chat with the Bot. This is effectively the main window of the application.
        Parameters:
        botName - The name of the Bot to be run. This refers to the name of the root Folder of the Bot.
        traceMode - Enable or disable Verbose output from the bot. For Debugging. Only really affects the console output.
        action - The core Bot class has numerous Action states depending on what you want it to do. Mostly this will be Chat.
        desktop - The Desktop being used to display this window on. Used to draw subframes for things like images.
        log - The Main Logger.

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)

      • chat

        private java.lang.String chat(java.lang.String query)
        Utilty method for chatting to the specified bot.
        Parameters:
        query - The User message to the bot
        Returns:
        The response from the bot to the query, returns "Invalid Query" if a bad query is passed.

      • parseResponse

        private java.lang.String parseResponse(java.lang.String response)
        Method for cleaning up the response from the chat bot. This will also filter out and attempt to interpret responses from the bot for additional features, such as image urls and out of bounds calls.
        Parameters:
        response - The chatbot response that needs to be parsed
        Returns:
        A cleaned up version of the chatbot response
